com.mathtastic.controller

Class AnswerQuestion

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.mathtastic.controller.AnswerQuestion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(urlPatterns="/answerQuestion")
public class AnswerQuestion
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    AnswerQuestion handles numbers sent through appleAdditionAskQuestion.jsp. Answers that are incorrect are added to a list of "tricky questions" to be displayed at end game and stored in the database if a user is logged in.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • compareAnswers

        private void compareAnswers(int childAnswer)
        Compares the answer submitted to the answer stored in the database. If the answer is correct, the question is removed from the list and the list is reset. If the answer is incorrect, the question is compared to the list of "tricky questions" and the list of "tricky questions" is reset.
        Parameters:
        childAnswer - The answer submitted

      • setQuestions

        private void setQuestions()
        Sets up the new ArrayList of questions.

      • instantiateTrickyQuestions

        private void instantiateTrickyQuestions()
        Instantiates the list of "tricky questions" if it doesn't already exist.

      • compareToTrickyQuestions

        private void compareToTrickyQuestions()
        Looks for the question asked in the current list of "tricky questions". If the question is in the list, the number of attempts are increased by 1. If the question is not in the list, it is added to the "tricky questions", and the minimum number of attempts is set.

      • setTrickyQuestions

        private void setTrickyQuestions()
        Sets the new session of "tricky questions".

      • setAnswerImages

        private void setAnswerImages()
        Gets the name of each image if they are requested and sets them.

      • setImage

        Returns:
        The image information.

      • displayAnswer

        private void displayAnswer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                    throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Displays the answer stored in the database. If images are requested, it sets them for display.
        Parameters:
